value.title: AI Weekly: AI prosecutors and pong-playing neurons closed out 2021
value.excerpt: Chinese researchers developed an AI system that recommends sentencing for criminals. Elsewhere, Cortical Labs trained neurons to play pong.

value.title: 2021 was a breakthrough year for AI
value.excerpt: As 2021 comes to a close, we take a quick look at all the major developments that took place in the AI space worldwide.

value.title: What Happens When an AI Knows How You Feel?
value.excerpt: Technology used to only deliver our messages. Now it wants to write them for us by understanding our emotions.

value.title: Facebook parent Meta uses AI to tackle new types of harmful content
value.excerpt: Meta, formerly known as Facebook, said Wednesday it has created artificial intelligence technology ... that's being pushed at the forefront of research."

value.title: 3 big problems with datasets in AI and machine learning
value.excerpt: Datasets in AI and machine learning contain many flaws. Some might be fixable, according to experts -- given enough time and resources.

value.title: Can AI Help Make Social Media More Accessible, Inclusive And Safe?
value.excerpt: In the latest edition of our “On AI Ethics” series, we caught up with Ramit Sawhney, Lead AI Scientist at Sharechat. Learn more about how the India-based social media unicorn leverages machine learning to to further its mission.

value.title: Bias in AI-driven recruiting subject of tech watchdog group
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence software is increasingly used by HR departments to screen job applicants. A new organization plans to prevent "AI" from producing biased results that influence hiring.

value.title: AI Weekly: AI researchers release toolkit to promote AI that helps to achieve sustainability goals
value.excerpt: A set of tools released by researchers, SustainBench, aims to promote the development of AI systems that help achieve sustainability goals.

value.title: The limitations of scaling up AI language models
value.excerpt: In a panel at NeurIPS 2021, experts discussed the limitations of training larger and larger natural language models akin to OpenAI's GPT-3.

value.title: Group backed by top companies moves to combat AI bias in hiring
value.excerpt: Some of the largest corporations in America are joining an effort to prevent artificial intelligence technology from delivering biased results that could perpetuate or even worsen past discrimination.

value.title: Codifying humanity: Why AI sucks at content moderation
value.excerpt: Meta unveiled a new content moderation AI system that it claims is a step towards generalized AI systems. We think they might be exaggerating.

value.title: How bias creeps into the AI designed to detect toxicity
value.excerpt: Bias can creep into the AI models used to determine whether comments are 'toxic' versus 'non-toxic,' leading to harmful mistakes.

value.title: Black people use Facebook more than anyone, but now they're leaving
value.excerpt: Brandon Keyes, a 37-year-old Army combat veteran from Detroit, has an on-again, off-again relationship with Facebook. These days, it's mostly off.

value.title: DeepMind makes bet on AI system that can play poker, chess, Go, and more
value.excerpt: Alphabet-backed DeepMind developed a system, called Player of Games, that can win at both imperfect and perfect information games.

value.title: Zuckerberg And Chan Pledge $500 Million Of Their Facebook Fortune To Create An AI Institute At Harvard
value.excerpt: Zuckerberg and Chan, who met at a Harvard fraternity party in 2003, have already given $42 million to Harvard.

value.title: Gurugram-based Krishify taps AI, ML to help farmers earn more
value.excerpt: A Gurugram-based agtech startup platform, Krishfy, is trying to put machine learning (ML), artificial intelligence (AI) and the Android system to best use for farmers across the country by offering a one-stop solution to improve their economic status.

value.title: Stellantis’ AI strategy targets $22.6b in revenues by 2030
value.excerpt: Carmaker Stellantis announced a strategy Tuesday to embed AI-enabled software in 34 million vehicles across its 14 brands targeting 20 billion euros ($22.6 billion) in annual revenues

value.title: Supercomputers in enterprise AI
value.excerpt: Forward-thinking enterprises across the globe have recognised that the future of business success will depend on their ability to leverage AI, says Werner Coetzee, business development executive at Data Sciences Corporation.

value.title: For truly ethical AI, its research must be independent from big tech
value.excerpt: We must curb the power of Silicon Valley and protect those who speak up about the harms of AI

value.title: Ex-Google AI ethics expert Timnit Gebru to launch anti-bias research institute
value.excerpt: Timnit Gebru is launching an artificial intelligence research institute after Google fired her for claiming the company's AI were unethical.

value.title: The Movement to Hold AI Accountable Gains More Steam
value.excerpt: A New York City law requires algorithms used in hiring to be “audited” for bias. It’s the first in the US—and part of a larger push toward regulation.
